results.title: Something wild
results.creator_credit: Primitiva Religiosa, Jonathan Demme and Kenneth Utt
results.brief_description: Uptight tax consultant Charlie (Jeff Daniels) is picked up by eccentric, free-thinker Lulu (Melanie Griffith). Although he’s not entirely certain how he’s going to explain his sudden disappearance to his wife and his boss, he accompanies her on an impulsive journey to the farthest reaches of New Jersey. Lulu introduces Charlie as her husband to her friends and relatives attending a high school reunion. The couple is held hostage by holdup man Ray (Ray Liotta) who happens to be Lulu’s ex. When Ray makes it clear that he wants Lulu back, that’s when the real trouble begins. Cameos by John Sayles, John Waters and Charles Napier. Includes music scores by David Byrne, Laurie Anderson, John Cale.

results.title: Something wicked this way comes
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney, Peter Vincent Douglas and Jack Clayton
results.brief_description: A stranger known as Mr. Dark brings his evil travelling carnival to a small town and the task of saving family and friends from its destructive clutches falls upon a boy and his father, the town librarian. Based on Ray Bradbury’s novel of the same name. Cast includes Jason Robards, Jonathan Pryce, Diane Ladd, Pam Grier, Vidal Peterson.

results.title: Something to work for
results.creator_credit: Roundtable Productions, Leon S. Gold and Arthur Swerdloff
results.brief_description: Focuses on the problem of motivation from the management point of view. Reveals what happens when demands are high, when communication is open, and when people are given support and encouragement in reaching common goals.

results.title: Something to talk about = The Power of love
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Paula Weinstein, Anthea Sylbert and Lasse Hallstrom
results.brief_description: The marriage between Eddie and Grace (Julia Roberts and Dennis Quaid) is about to change big time when Grace catches her husband with another woman. Contrary to the belief that Grace is a meek, mild and passive wife, she does everything she can to draw attention to her cheating husband. Her actions aren’t appreciated by everyone however, including her father, a prominent figure in society who is embarrassed by his daughter’s public antics, as well as feeling threatened by her willingness to question masculine authority. Grace takes on the plight of cheated women en masse, and exposes the names of all the cheating husbands and their girlfriends in her Charity League meeting. Grace’s number one target however remains her husband, the only problem is her family keeps interfering which may help or hinder Grace’s plans for revenge, and change the family dynamics forever. Cast also includes Robert Duvall, Gena Rowlands and Kyra Sedgwick.

results.title: Something to sing about
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), AFFC, Something to Sing About, Marguerite Grey and Martin Daley
results.brief_description: The Sydney Gay and Lesbian Choir has a repertoire which ranges from Gershwin to madrigals, spirituals to ABBA. The choir represents a positive force within the community; not just on the gay scene but across contemporary Australia. This documentary focuses on the choir’s defence of their National Choral Championship and is an uplifting and moving experience.

results.title: Something to say (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Moorabbin College of TAFE, CRS, CSV and Raffi Ghazarian
results.brief_description: Four young adults in their early 20s who are deaf come together to view a video that was made of them six years earlier. They reflect on their past and describe their lives over the years since. They talk about their families, their work, and their special interests. Through this discussion, and re-enactments, we learn about the things they have discovered in their transition from school to adult life, their feelings and experiences, and the things that they would like to say to young deaf students, their teachers and parents, and the community at large.

results.title: Something to hide
results.brief_description: Harry Field’s (Peter Finch) life is turned into a nightmare when he offers a hitch-hiker (Linda Hayden) a lift. His problems are exacerbated by marital problems and alcoholism. Also starring Shelley Winters, Colin Blakely, John Stride and Linda Hayden. Also known as “Shattered” and based on the book by Nicholas Monsarrat.

results.title: Something Pacific
results.brief_description: Nam June Paik’s Something Pacific (1986) is made up of TVs buried in the grass outside and an interactive video wall within the building at the University of Southern California San Diego’s Media Center and is part of the Stuart Collection.

constellations_other.name: Lost and found
constellations_other.description: Blossoming from Alice Guy Blaché’s The Cabbage-Patch Fairy, this Constellation explores the impermanence and enduring nature of the moving image.

results.title: Something old, something new
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Malcolm Smith, Karl McPhee and Ben Lewin
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Migrant experience”.
Long-established and recent migrants describe the search for a personal balance between the old traditions and the new ways.
